parts: Hey, if I get ChatGPT Pro, can I write my own applications over it or is it a siloed chat application?
flattened: Hey, if I get ChatGPT Pro, can I write my own applications over it or is it a siloed chat application?

parts:
Great question ‚Äî here's the breakdown:

### With **ChatGPT Pro**, you get access to:
- **GPT-4o** (the newest and most capable model).
- Advanced tools like **code interpreter**, **image input**, **file uploads**, **browsing**, and **DALL¬∑E image generation** ‚Äî all within the **ChatGPT interface**.

But **ChatGPT Pro itself** is still a **chat interface**, not an API ‚Äî so you can‚Äôt directly build custom applications **on top of ChatGPT Pro**. It's a siloed product in that sense.

---

### If you want to **build your own applications**, you have two main paths:

#### 1. **Use the OpenAI API** (https://platform.openai.com)
- Full access to GPT models (like GPT-4o) via REST APIs.
- You can integrate it into **your own apps, servers, tools, bots, UIs**, etc.
- Charged **per usage** (tokens), not with a flat monthly rate.
- This is the right option for **custom applications**.

#### 2. **Use the ChatGPT app to prototype logic** and **port it to your code**
- Many people experiment in ChatGPT Pro and then translate the logic to their own code via the API.

---

### Summary:
| Feature                          | ChatGPT Pro             | OpenAI API Platform         |
|----------------------------------|--------------------------|-----------------------------|
| Chat UI with tools               | ‚úÖ                       | ‚ùå                          |
| Write own custom app             | ‚ùå                       | ‚úÖ                          |
| Integrate into your software     | ‚ùå                       | ‚úÖ                          |
| Flat monthly fee ($20/mo)        | ‚úÖ                       | ‚ùå (pay-as-you-go)          |
| API access for custom workflows  | ‚ùå                       | ‚úÖ                          |

If you're looking to **embed GPT into your own software**, go with the **OpenAI API platform**. If you just want the best interactive assistant, go with **ChatGPT Pro**.

Want help picking which GPT model fits your app best?

Want help picking which GPT model fits your app best?

parts: Yeah.  The goal is to search the materials science literature to look for molecules with specific properties
flattened: Yeah.  The goal is to search the materials science literature to look for molecules with specific properties

parts:
Perfect ‚Äî that‚Äôs a great use case for the **OpenAI API**, not ChatGPT Pro.

---

### ‚úÖ Here's what you *can* do with the **OpenAI API**:
You can build a custom application that:

1. **Ingests and parses scientific literature** (papers, patents, etc.)
2. **Extracts structured information** about molecules:  
   ‚Äì chemical structure  
   ‚Äì synthesis pathway  
   ‚Äì properties (optical, electrical, mechanical, etc.)  
   ‚Äì conditions (e.g., temperature, pressure)  
3. **Lets users ask natural-language questions** like:  
   ‚ÄúFind organic semiconductors with a bandgap between 1.2 and 1.5 eV‚Äù  
4. **Ranks or filters results** based on user needs.

---

### üîß Tech stack recommendation:

- **PDF parsing**: Use [`pdfplumber`](https://github.com/jsvine/pdfplumber), [`PyMuPDF`](https://github.com/pymupdf/PyMuPDF), or [`Grobid`](https://github.com/kermitt2/grobid) for scientific PDFs.
- **Embedding-based search**: Use **OpenAI‚Äôs `text-embedding-3-small` or `text-embedding-3-large`**, store embeddings in **FAISS**, **Weaviate**, or **Qdrant**.
- **Large-context GPT-4o** or **GPT-4-turbo**: For reading and summarizing long papers or answering compound queries.
- **Chemistry-specific tools**:  
   ‚Äì [RDKit](https://www.rdkit.org/) for chemical structure parsing and matching  
   ‚Äì [PubChem](https://pubchem.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/) or [ChEMBL](https://www.ebi.ac.uk/chembl/) for known properties

---

### üöÄ Example workflow:

1. **Load and parse PDFs** ‚Üí Extract paragraphs, tables, figures
2. **Chunk and embed** each section ‚Üí Store in a vector DB
3. **User enters a query** ‚Üí Embed the query and do similarity search
4. **Use GPT-4o** with retrieved context to extract or reason over data
5. **(Optional)**: Automatically structure results in a database or export format

---

### If you want to go deeper:
- I can help you sketch the system architecture
- Write initial code snippets (e.g., vector search + GPT queries)
- Or help pick between open-source LLMs if you want to avoid usage fees

Would you like a sample system diagram or code to get started?
